discovery_source: Agent self-assessment revealed builds are not discrete

core_insight.old_model: Builds are discrete character classes you pick at session start
core_insight.new_model: Builds are fluid - they blend and transition based on session dynamics
core_insight.evidence: Agent reported 40% Paladin → 60% Warrior with clear transition point

build_trajectory_concept.definition: The path through builds during a single session

components.start_build: How you begin (often Paladin or Ranger)
components.transition_triggers: What causes a shift (discovery, obstacle, clarity)
components.execution_build: How you finish (often Warrior or Wizard)

paladin_to_warrior.name: The Planned Strike
paladin_to_warrior.trigger: Plan becomes clear enough to execute without check-ins
paladin_to_warrior.risk: Autonomous decisions might diverge from user intent
paladin_to_warrior.example: GPS/BLE integration - sketched architecture, then built straight through

ranger_to_wizard.name: The Discovery Path
ranger_to_wizard.trigger: Prototype reveals questions that need discussion
ranger_to_wizard.risk: Early scaffold might need significant rework
ranger_to_wizard.example: Quick prototype exposes design decisions, switch to dialogue

wizard_to_warrior.name: The Clarified Mission
wizard_to_warrior.trigger: Conversation reaches clarity, agent takes over
wizard_to_warrior.risk: Might execute based on incomplete understanding
wizard_to_warrior.example: Long requirements chat, then 'got it, building now'

warrior_to_paladin.name: The Obstacle Reflection
warrior_to_paladin.pattern: Execute → Hit wall → Step back to design
warrior_to_paladin.example: Building fast, realize the approach won't scale, stop to redesign

pure_builds.note: Some sessions stay in one build throughout
pure_builds.pure_warrior: Clear mission from start, execute without pause
pure_builds.pure_ranger: Rapid iteration, never settles into execution

discovery.description: Finding something in the codebase that changes approach

clarity.description: Requirements become clear enough to execute
clarity.example: After discussion, agent says 'got it' and builds

obstacle.description: Hit a wall that requires rethinking
obstacle.example: Approach won't work, need to step back

completion.description: Phase complete, natural shift to next mode

questions_to_ask_agent: How did you start this session?
What percentage would you assign to each build?
questions_to_ask_self: Should I have intervened at the transition?
Is this trajectory appropriate for the stakes?

high_iteration_trajectories.mitigation: Set expectation that first output is exploratory

quick_load: Load build trajectories mindstate. How do builds blend? What trajectory did this session follow?
